availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
The State of Rhode Island and Providence Plantations
Providence County ss.

I Henry Martin, residing in Providence, in the County of Providence, in the State of Rhose Island, appointed by the Governor of the State of Kentucky, a Commissioner for said State of Rhode Island, to take the proof and acknowledgment of deeds and other instruments, and to administer oaths pursuant to the Act of the legislature of said State of Kentucky, approved January 7. 1852, do solemnly swear, that I will well and faithfully execute and perform all the duties of such Commissioner, under and by virtue of the Laws of Kentucky.
Taken, subscribed and sworn to this eighteenth day of January A.D 1862.

Before me
Albert M. Hewitt
Justice of the Peace.

Rhode Island
Comr. of Deeds
Oath
Henry Martin
Filed Jany 22d 1862
